page.title: 02FARMING AND VEGETATION
page.content: THE SHARP DIVIDE IN GEOLOGY IS ALSO REFLECTED IN VEGETATION AND LAND USE. THE MOORLAND AND HEATH ARE USED FOR ROUGH GRAZING OF CATTLE SHEEP AND HORSES.ALTHOUGH POOR IN SPECIES THIS AREA PRODUCES SPECTACULAR SEASONAL COLOUR CHANGES DUE TO BRACKEN,MOORGRASS,COTTON GRASS,CROSS LEAVED HEATH,HEATHER AND GORSE.ON THE LIMESTONE FARMING LAND IS VERY GOOD AND CLASSIFIED AS BROWN EARTH.IT IS LOAMY AND GRAVELLY AND CAN BE 1 METRE DEEP.LIVESTOCK ARE KEPT FOR CONSUMPTION AND MILK AND A WIDE VARIETY OF PROFITABLE CASH CROPS ARE GROWN SUCH AS POTATOES BRASSICAS SWEDES AND OTHER ARABLE CROPS.
